page.title: 01The village of Lambourn
page.content: Lambourn is in the Royal County of Berkshire.It is situated in central southern England,70 miles west of London.The village is dominated by a beautiful Norman church which stands in the centre.Alongside,is the Market Place with the Market Cross.A river runs through the village-it is the river Lambourn which flows through Eastbury also,three miles away.The locality is well-known for its racehorses and contains many stables.There are many racing personalities living in the area-Fred Winter and John Francome,for example.In the centre of the village are the shops,banks and public houses.There are some old alms houses as well.The Primary School overlooks the village from its position on the hill.Lambourn lies on the Berkshire Downs.The population is 3,500.
